documents.document: “Some guys feel the weight of a contract. Some guys actually get freed by not having to worry about a contract." https://t.co/LxUenOYCJD
Wrote about Marcus Johansson quietly having a strong season, freed by contract security for a change https://t.co/LxUenOYCJD
The NHL's compressed schedule has been a pain for many around the league this season. But it's benefitted Grubauer. https://t.co/9YmeO4CoqG
@ericfingerhut why i've always been skeptical of how a pro team would do there. people have allegiances elsewhere when they get to norfolk.
@ericfingerhut as someone who's lived in norfolk briefly, it's a varied fandom because of the navy presence there. lots of people moving in.
Alex Ovechkin gets another golden stick. https://t.co/BNqX9iLXsg
But what an exit. https://t.co/5iWD7EBnaL
An Alex Ovechkin head on a stick was taped to the wall right beside Alex Ovechkin's locker room stall.
@StephenT6 so about that jinx? Oh, right, jinxes aren't real.
Lars, this team likes to pour it on, eh? Eller: “It’s definitely not something I’ve experienced before playing on any other teams."
“I think everybody, once they’re on the ice, they think they can score a goal right now,” Lars Eller said.
Lars Eller on Caps: "It just speaks to how everybody wants more. We want more all of the time. You want to score another goal."
Trotz joked that Johansson has "obviously" been lifting weights because he snapped his stick on that shot in the first period.
Philipp Grubauer said the new pants are like "skinny European jeans." Which he wears often. Didn't feel much of a difference in them.
Justin Williams against his old team.
This is already the most saves Grubauer has made in a game this season. 37 at the moment.
@JoshuaCooper @helenenothelen @dougherty_jesse it was really just @alex_prewitt and I bobbing heads and playing an imaginary fiddle.
@rmhopmayer might be a top five song for me.
@helenenothelen @dougherty_jesse psh, I'm the nicest.
Just jamming to some "Devil Went Down to Georgia" at Verizon Center.
The two losses were both to the Blue Jackets. https://t.co/uPs5plZ6E1
@BeccaH_JR the Kings fan base that follows me on twitter is my favorite. they're so nice.
Caps up, 4-0, after two.
This might be the best I've seen Grubauer play all season.
I think that's a priority. https://t.co/xlmHcckyMo
Oshie goal. Water bottle. Caps up, 4-0.
Philipp Grubauer wasn't thrilled with switching to thinner pants halfway through the season. He might love them now.
Oshie for cross-checking.
The Caps look like they're playing video game hockey with all of the cheat codes.
A reminder: Brett Connolly was a really good signing for the Caps.
Connolly goal. His 10th of the season. Caps up, 3-0.
Martinez for hooking.
Considering both teams played less than 24 hours ago, think this is a pretty entertaining game with good pace.
That snapped a seven-game goal drought for Marcus Johansson.
Caps up, 2-0, after two periods.
@muneebalamcu against the blues. off the draw. second period.
Slowly, quietly Marcus Johansson is having a heckuva season. 16 goals and 17 assists.
Dowd for interference.
Grubauer has been sharp early on. Just made a pair of point-blank stops on Brown.
Johansson had a good look, and then his stick snapped in half.
Caps' PK had a good day yesterday, limiting third-ranked Montreal PP to just two shots in three opportunities.
Delayed penalty on Caps/Winnik for goalie interference.
Third line nearly just scored again. Eller has 10 points in 13 games. That trio is feeling good.
Eller was all alone in front of Budaj for a while. https://t.co/G14e21FqZi
That's Eller's sixth goal in 13 games. He's feeling it finally.
Eller goal right in front. Caps up, 1-0.
Kings stayed in the locker room for the ceremony.
Justin Williams shrugs on Ovi celebration video. "Pretty good."
Give @dougherty_jesse a follow as he covers his last Kings game before joining Team WaPo.
Caps starting their third line of Connolly-Eller-Burakovsky and Carlzner pair. https://t.co/WyhYN3sbNo
Peter Budaj goes for the Kings.
Grubauer leads the Caps out and will start.
@BeccaH_JR in fairness, every team plays soccer there.
@T2Va haven't tried. Not a big snapchatter
Ovechkin heads everywhere. https://t.co/QPzXuFkux8
Trotz said Kings' Drew Doughty has some "junkyard" in him. Has "bite" to his game.
Trotz said "a goalie" will play. Wouldn't commit to which one. Smart money is on Grubauer.
@BenRothenberg what is this?
He's always watching. https://t.co/Q8xRQLUk6P
The Capitals have returned Jakub Vrana to Hershey.
@swisschris19 nope. fourth line was good tonight.
@AdamVingan you're really on brand about all of this today.
Braden Holtby's review of his new tight pants: https://t.co/8cJsWcnMdb
@sickunbelievabl it was funny!
Sup, Nicklas? (Screenshot from @CSNCapitals video) https://t.co/M43mlCQCkz
Oh, and I made it to the Montreal airport with time to spare. #blessed
Bottom-six snipes put the Capitals up and a "muffin" from Backstrom kept them ahead in a 3-2 win at Bell Centre https://t.co/4m7zqRZFUU
btw, Beagle said his eyes were closed on his goal. "And then top shelf." Said it was a "pretty nice" shot.
Holtby on pants: "Going post to post while down was tricky, mainly because they're new, I think."
Clarification on this: Holtby said the pants were "a little strange," not weird. https://t.co/AlNDP4DHZ1
Holtby said he was the one to alert the officials of the hole in the boards. "I've never seen that before."
Holtby joked that it was probably a Shea Weber shot that created the hole in the dasher board. (Believe it was actually Niskanen).
@ArshoffFred they did wear them in practices. but there hasn't been many practices.
Holtby said the new, thinner pants were "weird," but added that it could just be because they're new (as in not completely broken in).
Backstrom said Burakovsky and Beagle's goals were "snipes." "And a muffin by me," he added.
Caps win, 3-2.
This Holtby fellow is good, eh?
Habs have an empty net.
Tight pants didn't keep Holtby from going into a split to stop that Galchenyuk shot.
Not sure how the game isn't tied, but it's not. Yet.
@thadmoore @jdawsey1 @cmcampbell6 @StephenGarcia ha, we all know how I felt about it at the time.
Caps PK had a rough last game. Perfect tonight.
Burakovsky for high sticking. Caps clinging to a 3-2 lead.
Pacioretty makes it 3-2.
Here's @barrysvrluga's column on the underrated Nicklas Backstrom https://t.co/MPMKv5yOie
Backstrom goal. Someone wrote a really good column about him recently. Caps up, 3-1.
Radulov for hooking.
Caps have twice as many shots as Habs through two periods. Canadiens have just 12. Feels like they'd have more.
End of two periods: Caps have a 2-1 lead over the Canadiens. Eller looked a bit jostled by that last shift.
@BenCarroll15 how interesting.
@brandon__alter or it's just a typo. because i'm a human being.
What a stop by Hotlby on Radulov, who is clearly feeling it tonight.
Orpik for tripping. Caps going to a PK for a SECOND time this period.
Goaltender interference on Pacioretty. But before that, the Radulov celly was epic.
Radulov's goal immediately waved off.
And Eller gets a point against his former team. He started the whole sequence with a pass to Connolly on the breakout.
What a shot by Andre Burakovsky. Wow. Caps up, 2-1.
Until that penalty, Carlson was one of three NHLers with 40-plus games who hadn't taken a penalty. Johnny Gaudreau hasn't either.
Carlson for interference. AND THAT IS HIS FIRST PENALTY OF THE SEASON.
The first period is over. Hot dog time. Teams are tied, 1-1.
